citation.article-title: Nocardioides koreensis sp. nov., Nocardioides bigeumensis sp. nov. and Nocardioides agariphilus sp. nov., isolated from soil from Bigeum Island, Korea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nocardioides agariphilus sp. nov.
Nocardioides agariphilus (a.ga.ri.phi′lus. N.L. n. agarum agar; Gr. adj. philos loving; N.L. masc. adj. agariphilus agar-loving).
Cells are aerobic, non-spore-forming, Gram-positive cocci to short rods (0.2–0.5×1.3–3.0 μm).
Colonies are irregular, smooth, flat, white to cream in colour and 1.5–2.7 mm in diameter after 7 days incubation on R2A medium at 28 °C.
Good growth is observed on agar without any addition of carbon and nitrogen sources.
No aerial or substrate mycelium is formed, even after long incubation (40 days).
Growth occurs at 25–37 °C but not at or below 20 °C or above 37 °C.
No growth in 2 % NaCl or more.
Cellulose is not hydrolysed and tests for H2S production, DNase and citrate hydrolysis are negative.
Cell-wall peptidoglycan contains ll-DAP as the diagnostic diamino acids.
Predominant menaquinone is MK-8(H4) and diphosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylglycerol are the phospholipids found in the cell wall.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 69.4 mol%.
Other phenotypic properties are given in Table 1.
The type strain, MSL-28T (=KCTC 19276T =DSM 19323T), was isolated from a soil sample collected from Bigeum Island, Republic of Korea.
